title: PRD ReDesign: Cannabis Category Page

characteristics: Goals: fast access, clear timelines for approval and delivery, transparency about pricing, cancellation, and doctor approval
Sensitive to price, THC %, and quality of flower
Some come looking for specific strains; want stock visibility immediately
Use cannabis for anxiety, depression, chronic pain, or other medical conditions
Less familiar with strains/products; rely on doctor guidance
Require reassurance: professional process, secure data handling, privacy
Need clarity on prescription-only flows and treatment recommendations

user_problems: Users don't understand clearly how the process works and how long approval takes
Delivery options are unclear, users need transparent info about 1-2 day delivery, 2h express, and self-pickup
Users lack trust in quality and availability of cannabis flowers (stock visibility is essential)
No clear explanation of cancellation and refund policy
Prescription-only flow is confusing - patients don't understand what happens if a doctor rejects their request
Stock listing lacks key information (THC %, CBD %, strain type, availability)
No effective filtering/search tools for quickly finding relevant products
success_indicators: +20% increase in conversion to consultation start page
+10% increase in conversion from category page to paid order

development_requirements.description: Display the global DoktorABC USPS component at the top of the page. It should maintain the same layout, icons, and rotation logic as other pages.
Display the global Navbar of the site. It includes: company logo, search bar, cart, My Account, and hamburger menu. The Navbar must be sticky while scrolling.
Display the CRM coupon strip for the Cannabis category. The coupon text and design are pulled dynamically from CRM. On mobile, the coupon appears above the navbar.
Display the navigation path showing the user's route from Home → Cannabis Category → Product Page.

The Hero Section includes: Category image pulled dynamically from the DB (editable in BO). Category title and secondary title pulled from DB (localized). 'Go to funnel' CTA button that navigates to the start of the cannabis consultation flow. A medical evaluation and prescription bar that displays: '€18.90 + cannabis-based medication from €3.00'. Both values are dynamic and pulled from DB. Trusted Shops widget (same logic as production) displayed below the pricing bar.

Display the following cannabis-specific USPs (icons and short descriptions): 1500+ cannabis flowers – Real-time stock: the number is pulled dynamically from DB showing total available cannabis flower SKUs. Delivery options: Express 2h, Self-pickup, 1-2 days delivery. Register in 5 minutes – Just 3 steps. 24/7 customer service – Quick medical guidance. All text and formatting must match the design in Figma and be fully localized for FR/DE.

The search section includes: Search bar - identical logic and design as the current cannabis product search (pulls from DB). By default, no products are displayed on the category page until the user clicks on the search bar (same behavior as production). Once clicked, products are displayed, each card showing: Product image, Product name, Strain, % of THC and CBD, Price starting from (dynamic from DB), CTA 'Start consultation' (leads to the cannabis funnel).
Display the 'How It Works' component of the site. Use the same layout and step descriptions as other DoktorABC pages.
Display the Press Section identical to the homepage version, showing 'DoktorABC in the Press' and a rotating logo carousel. The headline remains static.
Display the FAQ widget, pulling all questions and answers dynamically from the DB. The first question should open by default. Content must be localized per country.
Display the Cannabis Category Drilldown component. Each drilldown block contains personalized CTAs and copy related to cannabis use cases, encouraging the user to start the consultation funnel.
Display the privacy banner component. Text and icons must follow global site design and be localized (FR/DE).
Display the Self-Pickup banner with text explaining the pickup option ('Pick up your order within 1-2 days from a partner pharmacy'). Banner design identical to the one used on other pages.
Display the Customer Review component (Trusted Shops and site reviews) identical to other pages. Reviews are pulled dynamically from DB or API.
Display all accepted payment methods (credit card, PayPal, Klarna, etc.) in a horizontal strip. Layout and style must match the global design.

Display the black-and-green banner titled 'Therapie mit medizinischem Cannabis.' Include all written content exactly as shown in the Figma design, including cannabis-specific USPs and a CTA button that links to the start of the consultation funnel.
Display the 'Medically and professionally tested' section identical to the other site pages. Content and structure are pulled dynamically from DB.
Display the Disclaimer section containing all required medical/legal text, pulled from DB. The content must be localized (FR/DE).
Display the More Information section pulled dynamically from DB, same logic and structure as in production.

Display the CRM component for user subscription. When a user enters an email and subscribes: If the email exists → show an 'already subscribed' message. If new → send the email as a lead to HubSpot, passing the site URL and Cannabis Category Page parameters. Display confirmation message on success.
Display the DoktorABC Footer with localized links, logos, compliance badges, payment icons, and legal information. Identical layout to other pages.
